column4: Hey, can anyone tell me if it's possible to upgrade to Edgy from the CD instead of the 'net?
Hey, can anyone tell me if it's possible to upgrade to Edgy from the CD instead of the 'net?
sure.  just open the CD in your repository list in Synaptic.
and turn OFF all the actual repositories.
okay, I'll just give it a shot. Open the CD in the rep. list in Synaptic and turn off all the real sources?
never tried it myself.  only theory.  I don't see how it could break anything though.
ha, okay. It's not like I have anything important on here anyway.
it just MIGHT be a first.  :)
you think there might be wiki page on this?
seems like something like that ought to have been mentioned at least once on ubuntuforums.org.  Go there and do a search.  "upgrade CD only"
yeah, I only wanna use the CD. Have a slow-ass connection.
good to hear.  Tell us how it goes.
you're upgrading from Dapper to Edgy?
yes. From a fresh Dapper install to Edgy because I want Firefox 2.0 and Exaile.
omeil_, have you considered Automatix?
I was councelled not to use Automatix.
I have also heard that Automatix is not ideal, but hey... it works.
I think it was designed for Dapper, or something.  I think that Edgy may be a whole different flavor potato chip.
I installed Beryl on Edgy with Automatix and it worked perfectly. It is by far the easiest way to install Beryl, but no recommended by the Beryl team...
Synaptic is really easy to use.  Just show her how to use the search command.  Simple.
Flannel... upgrade completely messed up my install. Ubuntu won't boot anymore. :-(
i'm sorry to hear that.  is anyone helping you?
